courseDescription: May be repeated for credit.  Supervised experience in the international business work place requiring written statement of objectives and evaluation of experience.  Pass/fail grading only.
Supervised experience in the international business work place requiring written statement of objectives and evaluation of experience.  Pass/fail grading only.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Professional interaction in a business setting
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to evaluate and improve business processes

courseDescription: A survey course to provide an overview of the contemporary business environment in Europe, with a focus on the European Union.  Topics will include an examination of the social, political, and economic forces which affect business in Europe.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of the European Union's business environment
Knowledge of social, political, and economic forces in Europe
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication within a European business context
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of the impact of social, political, and economic forces on business
Strategic thinking in a European context
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Developing business strategies for European markets
Leading in a culturally diverse environment

courseDescription: A survey  to provide an overview of the contemporary business environment in Latin America.  Topics will include an examination of the social, political and economic forces which affect business in Latin America.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Managing business in volatile economic conditions

courseDescription: An analysis of business practices in Asia.  Emphasis will be on business, government relations, business strategy, structure, organizational processes, and human resource management.
An applied field research study to develop an export trade plan which involves market analysis, risk analysis, financing and distribution decisions in overseas markets.

This course examines the sources of international business law, the relationship between such law and the U.S. legal system, the choice of law in international business disputes, the special issues that arise when doing business with foreign governments, the law governing international sales and the shipment of goods, and international intellectual property protection. In addition, the relationships between law and culture involved in international business transactions will be examined.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of international intellectual property protection
Knowledge of laws governing shipment of goods
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of legal systems and laws
Evaluating issues in business with foreign governments
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Navigating legal and cultural complexities in international business
Decision making in choosing law for international business disputes

courseDescription: International HRM focuses on the management of human resources in an international context.  The course will focus on policies, programs and practice characteristics of organizational efforts to manage human assets worldwide, including an overview of cross-national team dynamics and communication systems, leadership techniques, and national employment laws.  It will also explore the critical impact that these policies have on the success of firms in doing business abroad.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of international HR policies and programs
Understanding of cross-national team dynamics and communication systems
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analyzing the impact of HR policies on international business success
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Management of human resources in international context

courseDescription: This course provides an economic overview of international trade and the theories that support globalization and international trade policies. The course introduces students to the global value chain and its stakeholders, with an emphasis on costs, transportation, infrastructure, and technology. Students will examine supply chain management processes that organizations use to successfully manage import and export operations.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of supply chain management processes
Familiarity with import and export operations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to identify and engage with stakeholders in the global value chain
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Understanding and analysis of transportation and infrastructure aspects
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizing and managing global supply chains
Leadership in managing import and export operations

courseDescription: Lecture, discussion and case studies.  A capstone course to integrate and apply the theories and concepts learned in required international business courses to the operations of international business organizations.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Presentation of business theories and concepts
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Integration of international business theories and concepts
Decision making based on case studies

courseDescription: A study tour abroad arranged in cooperation with a foreign university, including lectures on international business topics and visits to international firms and economic/business organizations.  Written work required.
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordination of activities in foreign settings
Leading discussions on international business topics

courseDescription: Affords students the opportunity to undertake independent study under the direction of a faculty member.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Critical evaluation of international business concepts

courseDescription: Students will develop a deep understanding of the issues facing international firms.  The course will use case studies, lectures, and simulations to highlight the cultural, organizational, and financial challenges to doing business in various regions of the world with particular emphasis on Europe, China, and India.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of international business laws and regulations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Negotiation and conflict resolution in international business settings
Presentation of business strategies and case studies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis and interpretation of business case studies
Risk assessment in different global markets
Strategic problem-solving in international business contexts
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Project management in international business operations

courseDescription: This course covers topics from management, marketing, economics, and finance that are important to the study of international business.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Identifying and managing international business risks

courseDescription: This 2 hour capstone course covers topics facing international firms.  This course uses a combination of case studies, lectures, and simulations to highlight the cultural, organizational, and financial challenges to doing business in various regions of the world.
